meanings.definition: The dark shape and outline of someone or something visible against a lighter background.
meanings.sent1: The silhouette of the tree was striking against the sunset.
meanings.sent2: I could see the silhouette of the mountain against the bright sky.
meanings.sent3: The silhouette of the cat against the moonlight made it look like a mysterious creature.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the silhouette of the city skyline became a beautiful artwork.
meanings.sent5: The silhouette of the ship on the horizon was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: To represent someone or something as a dark shape and outline against a lighter background.
meanings.sent1: She decided to silhouette the profile of the bird in her artwork.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully silhouetted the figure against the bright canvas.
meanings.sent3: He playfully silhouetted his friend's face on the wall with a flashlight.
meanings.sent4: The photographer skillfully silhouetted the model against the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The designer chose to silhouette the logo for a bold effect.
